column2: dplyr::select(., subjects, condition, alpha_pos, pre, post, post_diff, signal)%>%
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'subjects', 'alpha_pos_condition', 'alpha_pos'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
plot1 <- ggplot(dat2plot2, aes(x = condition, y = modulation_induced, fill = condition)) +
stat_summary(fun.y=mean, aes(ymin=..y.., ymax=..y.., color =condition), geom='errorbar', width=0.9, size=1.5) +
plot2 <- ggplot(dat2plot2, aes(y = modulation_induced, fill = condition, x = 1)) +
geom_flat_violin(aes(fill = condition),position = position_nudge(x = .1, y = 0), adjust = 1.3, trim = FALSE, alpha = .5, colour = NA)+
plot3 <- ggplot(dat2plot3, aes(x = condition, y = modulation_induced, fill = condition)) +
stat_summary(fun.y=mean, aes(ymin=..y.., ymax=..y.., color =condition), geom='errorbar', width=0.9, size=1.5) +
plot4 <- ggplot(dat2plot3, aes(y = modulation_induced, fill = condition, x = 1)) +
geom_flat_violin(aes(fill = condition),position = position_nudge(x = .1, y = 0), adjust = 1.3, trim = FALSE, alpha = .5, colour = NA)+
plottitle <- ggdraw() + draw_label("alpha modulation | induced", fontface='bold')
plottitle1 <- ggdraw() + draw_label("contra left stimulus", fontface='bold')
plottitle2 <- ggdraw() + draw_label("contra right stimulus", fontface='bold')
plotplots <- ggarrange(plot1, plot2, plot3, plot4, ncol = 4,common.legend = TRUE,align = "h", widths=c(3,1,3,1))
